profiles.name: linux-baseline
profiles.title: DevSec Linux Security Baseline
profiles.summary: Test-suite for best-preactice Linux OS hardening

controls.title: Trusted hosts login
controls.desc: Rhosts/hosts.equiv files are a weak implemenation of authentication. Disabling the .rhosts and hosts.equiv support helps to prevent users from subverting the system's normal access control mechanisms of the system.

results.code_desc: Command find / -name '.rhosts' stdout should be empty
Command find / -name 'hosts.equiv'  stdout should be empty

controls.title: Check owner and permissions for /etc/shadow
controls.desc: Check periodically the owner and permissions for /etc/shadow

results.code_desc: File /etc/shadow should exist
File /etc/shadow should be file
File /etc/shadow should be owned by "root"
File /etc/shadow should not be executable
File /etc/shadow should be writable by owner
File /etc/shadow should be readable by owner
File /etc/shadow should not be readable by other
File /etc/shadow group should eq "root"
File /etc/shadow should not be readable by group
results.message: expected File /etc/shadow not to be readable by group

controls.title: Check owner and permissions for /etc/passwd
controls.desc: Check periodically the owner and permissions for /etc/passwd

results.code_desc: File /etc/passwd should exist
File /etc/passwd should be file
File /etc/passwd should be owned by "root"
File /etc/passwd should not be executable
File /etc/passwd should be writable by owner
File /etc/passwd should not be writable by group
File /etc/passwd should not be writable by other
File /etc/passwd should be readable by owner
File /etc/passwd should be readable by group
File /etc/passwd should be readable by other
File /etc/passwd group should eq "root"

controls.title: Dot in PATH variable
controls.desc: Do not include the current working directory in PATH variable. This makes it easier for an attacker to gain extensive rigths by executing a Trojan program

results.code_desc: Environment variable PATH split should not include ""
Environment variable PATH split should not include "."

controls.title: Check login.defs
controls.desc: Check owner and permissions for login.defs. Also check the configured PATH variable and umask in login.defs

results.code_desc: File /etc/login.defs should exist
File /etc/login.defs should be file
results.message: expected `File /etc/login.defs.file?` to return true, got false

results.code_desc: File /etc/login.defs should be owned by "root"
results.message: expected `File /etc/login.defs.owned_by?("root")` to return true, got false

results.code_desc: File /etc/login.defs should not be executable
File /etc/login.defs should be readable by owner
results.message: expected File /etc/login.defs to be readable by owner

results.code_desc: File /etc/login.defs should be readable by group
results.message: expected File /etc/login.defs to be readable by group

results.code_desc: File /etc/login.defs should be readable by other
results.message: expected File /etc/login.defs to be readable by other

results.code_desc: File /etc/login.defs group should eq "root"
login.defs ENV_SUPATH should include "/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin"
results.message: expected nil to include "/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin", but it does not respond to `include?`

results.code_desc: login.defs ENV_PATH should include "/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin"
results.message: expected nil to include "/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin", but it does not respond to `include?`

results.code_desc: login.defs UMASK should include "027"
results.message: expected nil to include "027", but it does not respond to `include?`

results.code_desc: login.defs PASS_MAX_DAYS should eq "60"
login.defs PASS_MIN_DAYS should eq "7"
login.defs PASS_WARN_AGE should eq "7"
login.defs LOGIN_RETRIES should eq "5"
login.defs LOGIN_TIMEOUT should eq "60"
login.defs UID_MIN should eq "1000"
login.defs GID_MIN should eq "1000"

controls.title: Check login.defs - RedHat specific
controls.desc: Check owner and permissions for login.defs. Also check the configured PATH variable and umask in login.defs

results.code_desc: Operating System Detection
results.skip_message: Skipped control due to only_if condition.

controls.title: Check for SUID/ SGID blacklist
controls.desc: Find blacklisted SUID and SGID files to ensure that no rogue SUID and SGID files have been introduced into the system

results.code_desc: [] should be empty

controls.title: Unique uid and gid
controls.desc: Check for unique uids gids

results.code_desc: /etc/passwd uids should not contain duplicates
/etc/group gids should not contain duplicates

controls.title: Entropy
controls.desc: Check system has enough entropy - greater than 1000

controls.title: Check for .rhosts and .netrc file
controls.desc: Find .rhosts and .netrc files - CIS Benchmark 9.2.9-10

results.code_desc: [] should be empty

controls.title: CIS: Disable unused filesystems
controls.desc: 1.1.1 Ensure mounting of cramfs, freevxfs, jffs2, hfs, hfsplus, squashfs, udf, FAT

results.code_desc: File /etc/modprobe.d/dev-sec.conf content should match "install cramfs /bin/true"
File /etc/modprobe.d/dev-sec.conf content should match "install freevxfs /bin/true"
File /etc/modprobe.d/dev-sec.conf content should match "install jffs2 /bin/true"
File /etc/modprobe.d/dev-sec.conf content should match "install hfs /bin/true"
File /etc/modprobe.d/dev-sec.conf content should match "install hfsplus /bin/true"
File /etc/modprobe.d/dev-sec.conf content should match "install squashfs /bin/true"
File /etc/modprobe.d/dev-sec.conf content should match "install udf /bin/true"
File /etc/modprobe.d/dev-sec.conf content should match "install vfat /bin/true"

controls.title: Do not run deprecated inetd or xinetd
controls.desc: http://www.nsa.gov/ia/_files/os/redhat/rhel5-guide-i731.pdf, Chapter 3.2.1

results.code_desc: System Package inetd
results.skip_message: The `package` resource is not supported on your OS yet.

results.code_desc: System Package xinetd
results.skip_message: The `package` resource is not supported on your OS yet.

controls.title: Do not install Telnet server
controls.desc: Telnet protocol uses unencrypted communication, that means the password and other sensitive data are unencrypted. http://www.nsa.gov/ia/_files/os/redhat/rhel5-guide-i731.pdf, Chapter 3.2.2

results.code_desc: System Package telnetd
results.skip_message: The `package` resource is not supported on your OS yet.

controls.title: Do not install rsh server
controls.desc: The r-commands suffers same problem as telnet. http://www.nsa.gov/ia/_files/os/redhat/rhel5-guide-i731.pdf, Chapter 3.2.3

results.code_desc: System Package telnetd
results.skip_message: The `package` resource is not supported on your OS yet.

controls.title: Do not install ypserv server (NIS)
controls.desc: Network Information Service (NIS) has some security design weaknesses like inadequate protection of important authentication information. http://www.nsa.gov/ia/_files/os/redhat/rhel5-guide-i731.pdf, Chapter 3.2.4

results.code_desc: System Package ypserv
results.skip_message: The `package` resource is not supported on your OS yet.

controls.title: Do not install tftp server
controls.desc: tftp-server provides little security http://www.nsa.gov/ia/_files/os/redhat/rhel5-guide-i731.pdf, Chapter 3.2.5

results.code_desc: System Package tftp-server
results.skip_message: The `package` resource is not supported on your OS yet.

controls.title: Install syslog server package
controls.desc: Syslog server is required to receive system and applications logs

results.code_desc: System Package rsyslog
results.skip_message: The `package` resource is not supported on your OS yet.

controls.title: Install auditd
controls.desc: auditd provides extended logging capacities on recent distribution

results.code_desc: System Package auditd
results.skip_message: The `package` resource is not supported on your OS yet.

results.code_desc: Audit Daemon Config log_file should cmp == "/var/log/audit/audit.log"
Audit Daemon Config log_format should cmp == "raw"
Audit Daemon Config flush should match /^INCREMENTAL|INCREMENTAL_ASYNC$/
Audit Daemon Config max_log_file_action should cmp == "ROTATE"
Audit Daemon Config space_left should cmp == 75
Audit Daemon Config action_mail_acct should cmp == "root"
Audit Daemon Config space_left_action should cmp == "SYSLOG"
Audit Daemon Config admin_space_left should cmp == 50
Audit Daemon Config admin_space_left_action should cmp == "SUSPEND"
Audit Daemon Config disk_full_action should cmp == "SUSPEND"
Audit Daemon Config disk_error_action should cmp == "SUSPEND"

controls.title: IPv4 Forwarding
controls.desc: If you're not intending for your system to forward traffic between interfaces, or if you only have a single interface, the forwarding function must be disable.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.ip_forward value should eq 0
Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.forwarding value should eq 0

controls.title: Reverse path filtering
controls.desc: The rp_filter can reject incoming packets if their source address doesn't match the network interface that they're arriving on, which helps to prevent IP spoofing.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter value should eq 1
Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.conf.default.rp_filter value should eq 1

controls.title: ICMP ignore bogus error responses
controls.desc: Sometimes routers send out invalid responses to broadcast frames. This is a violation of RFC 1122 and the kernel will logged this. To avoid filling up your logfile with unnecessary stuff, you can tell the kernel not to issue these warnings

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.icmp_ignore_bogus_error_responses value should eq 1

controls.title: ICMP echo ignore broadcasts
controls.desc: Blocking ICMP ECHO requests to broadcast addresses

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts value should eq 1

controls.title: ICMP ratelimit
controls.desc: icmp_ratelimit defines how many packets that match the icmp_ratemask per second

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.icmp_ratelimit value should eq 100

controls.title: ICMP ratemask
controls.desc: Ratemask is a logical OR of all ICMP codes to rate limit

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.icmp_ratemask value should eq 88089

controls.title: TCP timestamps
controls.desc: It is possible to estimate the current uptime of a Linux system. It's preferable to disable TCP timestamps on your systems.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.tcp_timestamps value should eq 0

controls.title: ARP ignore
controls.desc: Reply only if the target IP address is local address configured on the incoming interface.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.arp_ignore value should eq 1

controls.title: ARP announce
controls.desc: Always use the best local address for this target. In this mode we ignore the source address in the IP packet and try to select local address that we prefer for talks with	the target host.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.arp_announce value should eq 2

controls.title: TCP RFC1337 Protect Against TCP Time-Wait
controls.desc: This enables a fix for time-wait assassination hazards in tcp, described in RFC 1337. If enabled, this causes the kernel to drop RST packets for sockets in the time-wait state.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.tcp_rfc1337 value should eq 1

controls.title: Protection against SYN flood attacks
controls.desc: A SYN-Attack is a denial of service (DoS) attack that consumes resources on your system forcing you to reboot.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.tcp_syncookies value should eq 1

controls.title: Shared Media IP Architecture
controls.desc: Send(router) or accept(host) RFC1620 shared media redirects. If it is not set the kernel does not assume that different subnets on this device can communicate directly.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.shared_media value should eq 1
Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.conf.default.shared_media value should eq 1

controls.title: Disable Source Routing
controls.desc: The accept_source_route option causes network interfaces to accept packets with the Strict Source Route (SSR) or Loose Source Routing (LSR) option set. An attacker is able to send a source routed packet into the network, then he could intercept the replies and your server might not know that it is not communicating with a trusted server

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route value should eq 0
Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route value should eq 0

controls.title: Disable acceptance of all IPv4 redirected packets
controls.desc: Disable acceptance of all redirected packets these prevents Man-in-the-Middle attacks.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects value should eq 0
Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects value should eq 0

controls.title: Disable acceptance of all secure redirected packets
controls.desc: Disable acceptance of all secure redirected packets these prevents Man-in-the-Middle attacks.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.secure_redirects value should eq 0
Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.conf.default.secure_redirects value should eq 0

controls.title: Disable sending of redirects packets
controls.desc: Disable sending of redirects packets

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects value should eq 0
Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects value should eq 0

controls.title: Disable log martians
controls.desc: log_martians can cause a denial of service attack to the host

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.log_martians value should eq 1
Kernel Parameter net.ipv4.conf.default.log_martians value should eq 1

controls.title: Disable IPv6 if it is not needed
controls.desc: Disable IPv6 if it is not needed

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 value should eq 1

controls.title: IPv6 Forwarding
controls.desc: If you're not intending for your system to forward traffic between interfaces, or if you only have a single interface, the forwarding function must be disable.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.forwarding value should eq 0

controls.title: Disable acceptance of all IPv6 redirected packets
controls.desc: Disable acceptance of all redirected packets these prevents Man-in-the-Middle attacks.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_redirects value should eq 0
Kernel Parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_redirects value should eq 0

controls.title: Disable acceptance of IPv6 router solicitations messages
controls.desc: The router solicitations setting determines how many router solicitations are sent when bringing up the interface. If addresses are statically assigned, there is no need to send any solicitations.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv6.conf.default.router_solicitations value should eq 0

controls.title: Disable Accept Router Preference from router advertisement
controls.desc: Disable Accept Router Preference from router advertisement

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_ra_rtr_pref value should eq 0

controls.title: Disable learning Prefix Information from router advertisement
controls.desc: The accept_ra_pinfo setting controls whether the system will accept prefix info from the router.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_ra_pinfo value should eq 0

controls.title: Disable learning Hop limit from router advertisement
controls.desc: The accept_ra_defrtr setting controls whether the system will accept Hop Limit settings from a router advertisement. Setting it to 0 prevents a router from changing your default IPv6 Hop Limit for outgoing packets.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_ra_defrtr value should eq 0

controls.title: Disable the system`s acceptance of router advertisement
controls.desc: Setting controls whether the system will accept router advertisement

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_ra value should eq 0
Kernel Parameter net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_ra value should eq 0

controls.title: Disable IPv6 autoconfiguration
controls.desc: The autoconf setting controls whether router advertisements can cause the system to assign a global unicast address to an interface.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv6.conf.default.autoconf value should eq 0

controls.title: Disable neighbor solicitations to send out per address
controls.desc: The dad_transmits setting determines how many neighbor solicitations to send out per address (global and link-local) when bringing up an interface to ensure the desired address is unique on the network.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv6.conf.default.dad_transmits value should eq 0

controls.title: Assign one global unicast IPv6 addresses to each interface
controls.desc: The max_addresses setting determines how many global unicast IPv6 addresses can be assigned to each interface. The default is 16, but it should be set to exactly the number of statically configured global addresses required.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter net.ipv6.conf.default.max_addresses value should eq 1

controls.title: Disable loading kernel modules
controls.desc: The sysctl key kernel.modules_disabled is very straightforward. If it contains a "1" it will disable loading new modules, where a "0" will still allow loading them. Using this option will be a great protection against loading malicious kernel modules.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter kernel.modules_disabled value should eq 0

controls.title: Magic SysRq
controls.desc: Kernel.sysreg is a 'magical' key combo you can hit which the kernel will respond to regardless of whatever else it is doing, unless it is completely locked up.

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter kernel.sysrq value should eq 0

controls.title: Secure Core Dumps - dump settings
controls.desc: Ensure that core dumps can never be made by setuid programs

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter fs.suid_dumpable value should cmp == /(0|2)/

controls.title: Secure Core Dumps - dump path
controls.desc: Ensure that core dumps are done with fully qualified path

results.code_desc: Operating System Detection
results.skip_message: Skipped control due to only_if condition.

controls.title: kernel.randomize_va_space
controls.desc: kernel.randomize_va_space

results.code_desc: Kernel Parameter kernel.randomize_va_space value should eq 2

controls.title: CPU No execution Flag or Kernel ExecShield
controls.desc: Kernel features and CPU flags provide a protection against buffer overflows. The CPU NX Flag and the kernel parameter exec-shield prevents code execution on a per memory page basis. If the CPU supports the NX-Flag then this should be used instead of the kernel parameter exec-shield.

results.code_desc: /proc/cpuinfo Flags should include NX
Kernel Parameter kernel.exec-shield value should eq 1

options.description: Default umask to set in login.defs
Default password maxdays to set in login.defs
Default password mindays to set in login.defs
Default password warnage (days) to set in login.defs
blacklist of suid/sgid program on system
syslog package to ensure present (default: rsyslog, alternative: syslog-ng...
Should loading of kernel modules be disabled?
